{"step_by_step_thinking": "MAIT cells, or Mucosal-Associated Invariant T cells, are a type of immune cell that play a role in the body's defense against infections. Recent research has suggested that these cells may also have a role in cancer, including multiple myeloma. Studies have shown that MAIT cells can be found in the bone marrow of patients with multiple myeloma, and their presence may be associated with disease progression. Therefore, it can be concluded that MAIT cells do have a role in multiple myeloma.", "answer_choice": "A"}
